meanings.definition: To behave or dress in a fussy or overly proper manner.
meanings.sent1: She prissed around the room, adjusting every little detail.
meanings.sent2: He always prissed up before going out, making sure everything was just right.
meanings.sent3: The cat prissed around the house, avoiding any mess in its path.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden prissed in the gentle breeze, showing off their vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: Her doll's dress was prissed with lace and ribbons, looking like a tiny princess.

meanings.definition: To show disapproval or annoyance in a delicate or finicky way.
meanings.sent1: She prissed at the idea of eating broccoli, wrinkling her nose in distaste.
meanings.sent2: He prissed about the noisy neighbors, muttering complaints under his breath.
meanings.sent3: The toddler prissed at the vegetables on his plate, pushing them away with a pout.
meanings.sent4: The old man prissed at the young ones playing loud music, shaking his head disapprovingly.
meanings.sent5: Her cat prissed at the unfamiliar scent, arching its back in suspicion.
